citeinfo.title: Sevilleta LTER Meteorology Data, 1991
citeinfo.othercit: Contact info for data set originator: Moore, Doug Address:Department of Biology, MSC03 2020 Albuquerque, NM 87131 Email address:dmoore@sevilleta.unm.edu

descript.abstract:
This file contains the weather data for a network of 8 permanent weather stations on the Sevilleta Wildlife area, Langmuir Labs, and Bosque Del Apache Wildlife area for the year 1991. Station 40 has been in operation since the middle of 1987; Stations 41-44 were installed in the early part of 1989; Station 45 was put into operation on 26 Jan 1990 (hour 15); Station 46 was put into operation on 31 Aug 1990 (hour 17); and Station 47 was put into operation on 08 Jan 1991 (hour 16). The geographic locations of the various weather stations are as follows:
40 = Deep Well Site: Lat 34.3556, Long -106.6914 41 = South Gate Site: 34.2177, -106.7958 42 = Cerro Montosa Site: 34.3692, -106.5341 43 = Watersheds Site: 34.3892, -107.0398 44 = Rio Salado Site: 34.3489, -106.8802 45 = Bronco Well Site: 34.4068, -106.9328 46 = Langmuir Site: 33.97472 -107.1808 47 = Bosque Del Apache: **.****, ****.****
Note that Stations 40, 45, and 46 are the only stations that collect data on solar radiation. Also note that Station 47 is situated in a small clearing containing Salt Cedar within a Cottonwood canopy.
The data were recorded and stored by a Campbell Scientific CR10 Datalogger. Samples were taken every "n" seconds and values averaged for the hour (where n = 3 seconds for wind speed, wind direction, and solar radiation variables; n = 30 seconds for rh, air temperature, soil temperature, and mixing ratio variables; n = 300 seconds for soil moisture variables). Numbers were stored and processed in the datalogger in binary format with 23 bit precision. Final output was rounded to a maximum of 3 decimal digits.
The following variable description section provides detailed information on variables collected, units of measurement, and the format of the data section.

timeperd.current: as it was at time of compilation

status.update:
\log ************************ CHANGE LOG *****************************************
05 Feb 1992. Station 46. Replaced RH and Vapor Pressure data with missing values (-999) for periods: 14 Dec 91 (hr 05) to 17 Dec 91 (hr 06), and 27 Dec 91 (hr 17) to 29 Dec 91 (hr 02) due to malfunctioning RH/temp sensor. G.S.
05 Feb 1992. Station 46. Replaced Average, Max, Min, and Vectored Windspeed fields as well as Wind Direction, and Std. Dev. of Direction fields with missing values (-999) for periods: 11 Dec 91 (hr 15) to 13 Dec 91 (hr 04), and 18 Dec 91 (hr 03) to 28 Dec 91 (hr 02) due to anemometer malfunction during these periods. G.S.
05 Feb 1992. Station 46. Missing observations 13 Dec 91 (hr 17) through 13 Dec 91 (hr 18) due to unknown reasons (the observations were not in the data set when it was downloaded from the datalogger). Thus all sensor fields have value -999 for these 2 observations. G.S.
13 Jan 1992. Station 44. Replaced Vectored Windspeed, Wind Direction, and Std. Dev. of Direction fields with missing values (-999) for period 11 Dec 91 (hr 22) to 31 Dec 91 (hr 24) due to wind vane malfunction. G.S.
12 Dec 1991. Station 41. Replaced Vectored Windspeed, Wind Direction, and Std. Dev. of Direction fields with missing values (-999) for period 05 Nov 91 (hr 15) to 03 Dec 91 (hr 09) due to wind vane malfunction (directions were fixed at ~360 degrees). G.S.
03 Dec 1991. Station 41. Wind Vane sensor replaced 03 Dec 1991 (hr 10). G.S.
13 Nov 1991. General. Added a "type" section to this file documentation. G.S.
13 Nov 1991. Station 47. All data was lost during period 22 Aug 91 (hr 11) to 23 Aug 91 (hr 8) due to datalogger problems. Thus all observations for this period contain missing values. Also, installed new program on 23 Aug 91 (hr 9) which outputs battery voltage as an additional field. G.S
13 Nov 1991. Station 41. Replaced Vectored Windspeed, Wind Direction, and Std. Dev. of Direction fields with missing values (-999) for period 18 Oct 91 (hr 11) to 05 Nov 91 (hr 14) due to wind vane malfunction (directions were fixed at ~360 degrees). G.S.
25 Oct 1991. Station 42. Replaced anemometer on 25 Oct 91 (hr 13). G.S.
23 Sep 1991. Station 44. All data fields for period 02 Sept 91 (hr 13) to 11 Sept 91 (hr 13) contain missing values (-999) due to datalogger power loss before downloading. G.S.
23 Sep 1991. Station 42. Replaced Minimum, Average, Maximum and Vectored Windspeed fields with missing values (-999) for period 06 Sept 91 (hr 12) to 29 Sept 91 (hr 18) due to intermittent anemometer malfunction (windspeeds were reading 0.447 m/sec) Wind Direction values were not deleted but contain unknown error since all sample vectors used to calculate the hourly average had a magnitude of 0.447 m/sec. G.S.
10 Sep 1991. Station 40. New datalogger program installed on 02 Aug 91 (hr 16) so replaced all data fields with missing values (-999) for this hour. G.S.
10 Sep 1991. Station 41. New datalogger program installed on 02 Aug 91 (hr 12) so replaced all data fields with missing values (-999) for this hour. G.S.
10 Sep 1991. Station 42. New datalogger program installed on 02 Aug 91 (hr 15) so replaced all data fields with missing values (-999) for this hour. G.S.
10 Sep 1991. Station 44. Power loss during battery change on 01 Aug 91 (hr 13) so all data fields with contain missing values (-999) for this hour. Also had problems reinstalling datalogger program so all data fields contain missing values (-999) for hr 14 as well. G.S.
05 Jul 1991. Station 46. Replaced RH and Vapor Pressure data with missing values (-999) for period 06 Jun 91 (hr 7) to 25 Jun 91 (hr 13) due to defective RH sensor. Sensor replaced on 25 Jun 91 (hrs 12 and 13), so replaced Average, Max, Min Temperature variables also for 25 Jun 91 (hrs 12 and 13). G.S.
05 Jul 1991. Station 46. Changed precipitation value from 122.700 to 0.000 for 07 Jun 91 (hr 14) due to rain gauge problem. G.S.
05 Jul 1991. Station 46. Changed precipitation value from 3.500 to 0.000 for 19 May 91 (hr 11) due to rain gauge problem. G.S.
13 May 1991. Station 46. Average, Maximum, and Minimum, and Vectored Windspeed data corrected for period 01 Apr 91 (hr 12) to 06 May 91 (hr 12) as specified in the 25 Mar 1991 and 06 Mar 1991 change log entries below. G.S.
13 May 1991. Station 42. Zeroed precipitation data for 01 Apr 91 (hr 11) due to resetting of tipping bucket rain gauge (see 05 Apr 91 log entry). G.S.
13 May 1991. Station 41. Wind Direction data corrected for period 02 Jan 91 (hour 17) to 10 May 91 (hr 9) as follows: new_dir = (old_dir + 200) mod 360 This is to correct the mis-alignment of the wind vane for this period of time. G.S.
10 May 1991. Station 41. Realigned wind vane on 10 May 91 (hr 10) to give correct readings. When wind vane was replaced on 02 Jan 91, it was mis-aligned by 200 degrees (i.e., when reading 0 degrees, the true reading was 200 degrees). G.S.
06 May 1991. Station 46. Corrected datalogger program on 06 May 91 (hr 13) to use windspeed calibration factor of 0.8 instead of 0.26666. G.S.
06 Apr 1991. Station 47. Replaced 0.000 value reading in Max Solar Radiation field with missing value (-999) for 01 Mar 91 (hr 11) since this station does not have a pyranometer (but datalogger outputted a 0 values anyway). G.S.
05 Apr 1991. Station 46. Average, Maximum, and Minimum, and Vectored Windspeed data corrected for period 05 Mar 91 (hr 10) to 01 Apr 91 (hr 11) as specified in the 25 Mar 1991 and 06 Mar 1991 change log entries below. G.S.
05 Apr 1991. Station 42. Replaced precipitation data with missing values (-999) for period 26 Mar 91 (hr 1) to 01 Apr 91 (hr 10) due to tipping bucket rain gauge being tipped over (probably by high winds). G.S.
05 Apr 1991. Station 40. Wind Direction data corrected for period 04 Mar 91 (hr 17) to 12 Mar 91 (hr 15) as specified in 25 Mar 1991 change log entry below. Std. Dev. of Windspeed replaced with missing values (-999) also. The correct calibration factor was installed in the datalogger program on 12 Mar 91 (hr 16) so Wind Dir, Std. Dev. of Wind Dir, and Windspeed Vector were set to missing values for this hour. G.S.
25 Mar 1991. Station 40. Wind Direction data corrected for period 11 Jan 91 (hr 15) to 04 Mar 91 (hr 16) as follows: new_val = (old_val * 480/250) mod 360 This is because the excitation voltage for this sensor was changed (from 480 to 250) on 11 Jan 91 but the associated calibration factor was not changed accordingly. ***NOTE*** that Vectored Windspeed and Standard Deviation of Wind Direction are likewise affected by this problem. It was decided to replace the Standard Deviation field with missing values (-999) for this period. However, the Vectored Windspeed was left as is; thus this field has unknown ERROR. G.S.
25 Mar 1991. Station 46. Vectored Windspeed data corrected for period 01 Jan 91 (hr 1) to 05 Mar 91 (hr 9) as follows: If Vectored Windspeed >= 0.44704 then new_val = ((old_val - 0.44704) / 0.26666) * 0.8 + 0.44704 Else new_val = old_val This correction is made for the problem mentioned in the 06 Mar 1991 Log entry below for station 46. ***NOTE*** again that since the individual sample vectors are not available this correction is rough at best with exact ERROR unknown. G.S.
07 Mar 1991. Station 42. Replaced 0.000 value readings for Solar Radiation fields with missing values (-999) for period 03 Feb 91 (hr 12) to 04 Mar 91 (hr 10) since this station does not have a pyranometer (but datalogger is outputting 0 values anyway). G.S.
06 Mar 1991. Station 46. Average, Maximum, and Minimum Windspeed data corrected for period 01 Jan 91 (hr 1) to 05 Mar 91 (hr 9) as follows: new_val = ((old_val - 0.44704) / 0.26666) * 0.8 + 0.44704 This correction was made because it was discovered that a calibration constant of 0.26666 (instead of 0.8) was being used to calculate windspeed in the datalogger program. ***NOTE*** that the Vectored Windspeed, Wind Direction, and Standard Deviation of Wind Direction data were not corrected because they are calculated from the mean vector for the hour (i.e., the mean of 1200 vectors). Thus these data fields have an unknown ERROR. G.S.
06 Mar 1991. Station 46. Relative Humidity and Vapor Pressure data changed to missing values (-999) for period 01 Feb 91 (hr 10) to 05 Mar 91 (hr 9) due to bad channel or sensor. G.S.
06 Mar 1991. Station 47. All data was lost during period 05 Feb 91 (hr 10) to 28 Feb 91 (hr 8) due to datalogger problems. Thus all observations for this period contain missing values. G.S
11 Feb 1991. Station 47. All data was lost during period 08 Jan 91 (hr 16) to 05 Feb 91 (hr 9) due to datalogger problems. Thus all observations for this period contain missing values. G.S
11 Feb 1991. Station 46. Relative Humidity and Vapor Pressure data changed to missing values (-999) for period 06 Jan 91 (hr 15) to 01 Feb 91 (hr 9) due to bad channel or sensor. G.S.
11 Feb 1991. Station 42. ***NOTE*** that wind direction data for period 02 Jan 91 (hr 12) to 11 Jan 91 (hr 11) has possible maximum error of +-15 degrees due to incorrect calibration factor used in datalogger. Also, there are unknown ERRORS in the Vectored Windspeed and Standard Deviation of Wind Direction fields. G.S.
11 Feb 1991. Station 40. ***NOTE*** that wind direction data for period 02 Jan 91 (hr 15) to 08 Jan 91 (hr 16) has possible maximum error of +-15 degrees due to incorrect calibration factor used in datalogger. Also, there are unknown ERRORS in the Vectored Windspeed and Standard Deviation of Wind Direction fields. G.S.
18 Jan 1991. KEYWORDS Added. G.S.
18 Jan 1991. Station 40. All data was lost during period 01 Jan 91 (hr 1) to 02 Jan 91 (hr 14) due to datalogger malfunction. Thus all observations for this period contain missing values. G.S
18 Jan 1991. Station 42. Replaced Precipitation values with missing values for period 01 Jan 91 (hr 1) to 02 Jan 91 (hr 11) due to rain gauge being tipped over. G.S.
08 Jan 1991. Weather station #47 installed on the Bosque Del Apache National Wildlife Refuge. First (complete) hourly observation recorded at hour 16. Location: Bosque Del Apache Site: Lat. **, Long. **. GS.
02 Jan 1991. Station 41. Replaced wind vane on 02 Jan 91 (hr 17). G.S.
*********************** END CHANGE LOG **************************************

idinfo.useconst: Any Sevilleta LTER data set and accompanying metadata can be used for academic, research, and other professional purposes. Permission to use the data is granted to the Data User subject to the following terms: Data User will: 1) notify the designated contact (e.g., Principle Investigator or Data Set Contact) when any derivative work based on or derived from the data and documentation is distributed; 2) notify users that such derivative work is a modified version and not the original data and documentation distributed by the Sevilleta LTER; 3) not redistribute original data and documentation; 4) acknowledgethe support of the Sevilleta LTER and appropriate NSF Grant numbers in any publications using these data and documentation. (e.g. Data sets were provided by the Sevilleta LTER Data Bank. Funding for these data was provided by the National Science Foundation Long-Term Ecological Research program (NSF Grant numbers BSR 88-11906, DEB9411976, DEB0080529, DEB0217774); and 5) send two reprints of any publications resulting from use of the data and documentation to the following address: Sevilleta LTER Program Attn: Information Manager, Department of Biology, MSC03 2020, University of New Mexico, Albuquerque, NM 87131

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Biology, University of New Mexico

cntaddr.address: Department of Biology, University of New Mexico

method.methoddesc: Data CollectionThe data were recorded and stored by a Campbell Scientific 21x Datalogger.Samples were taken every 30 seconds and values averaged for the hour.Numbers were stored and processed in the datalogger in binary format with23 bit precision. Final output was rounded to a maximum of 3 decimal digits.However, true precision and accuracy of data values are restricted to thelimits specified in the variables description section.

procstep.procdesc: Read Methods description above if applies

soil temperature at 10 cm
